io.netty.channel.oio

Class AbstractOioByteChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.util.DefaultAttributeMap
      • io.netty.channel.AbstractChannel
        • io.netty.channel.oio.AbstractOioChannel
          • io.netty.channel.oio.AbstractOioByteChannel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Channel, AttributeMap, Comparable<Channel>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OioByteStreamChannel

    public abstract class AbstractOioByteChannel
extends AbstractOioChannel
    Abstract base class for OIO which reads and writes bytes from/to a Socket

      • isInputShutdown

        protected boolean isInputShutdown()

      • metadata

        public ChannelMetadata metadata()
        Description copied from interface: Channel
        Return the ChannelMetadata of the Channel which describe the nature of the Channel.

      • checkInputShutdown

        protected boolean checkInputShutdown()
        Check if the input was shutdown and if so return true. The default implementation sleeps also for AbstractOioChannel.SO_TIMEOUT milliseconds to simulate some blocking.

      • doRead

        protected void doRead()
        Specified by:
        doRead in class AbstractOioChannel

      • doWrite

        protected int doWrite(Object[] msgs,
          int msgsLength,
          int startIndex)
               throws Exception
        Description copied from class: AbstractChannel
        Flush the content of the given ByteBuf to the remote peer. Sub-classes may override this as this implementation will just thrown an UnsupportedOperationException
        Specified by:
        doWrite in class AbstractChannel
        Returns:
        the number of written messages
        Throws:
        Exception

      • available

        protected abstract int available()
        Return the number of bytes ready to read from the underlying Socket.

      • doReadBytes

        protected abstract int doReadBytes(ByteBuf buf)
                            throws Exception
        Read bytes from the underlying Socket.
        Parameters:
        buf - the ByteBuf into which the read bytes will be written
        Returns:
        amount the number of bytes read. This may return a negative amount if the underlying Socket was closed
        Throws:
        Exception - is thrown if an error accoured

      • doWriteBytes

        protected abstract void doWriteBytes(ByteBuf buf)
                              throws Exception
        Write the data which is hold by the ByteBuf to the underlying Socket.
        Parameters:
        buf - the ByteBuf which holds the data to transfer
        Throws:
        Exception - is thrown if an error accoured

      • doWriteFileRegion

        protected abstract void doWriteFileRegion(FileRegion region)
                                   throws Exception
        Write the data which is hold by the FileRegion to the underlying Socket.
        Parameters:
        region - the FileRegion which holds the data to transfer
        Throws:
        Exception - is thrown if an error accoured
